firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure has been simplified to use a single `/sessions` collection for all sessions. This removes the complexity of managing two separate collections for public and private sessions. Access control is now handled entirely by Firestore security rules, which inspect the `visibility` field within each session document. This is a more standard and efficient approach. User-owned data remains under `/users/{userId}` for clear path-based ownership.
